verses.verse: A man <S%H376><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Levi <S%H3878><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> a daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Levi as his wife. <S%H3878><s%>

The woman <S%H802><s%> conceived, <S%H2029><s%> and bore <S%H3205><s%> a son. <S%H1121><s%> When she saw <S%H7200><s%> that he was a fine <S%H2896><s%> child, <S%H6845><s%> she hid him three <S%H7969><s%> months. <S%H3391><s%>

When she could <S%H3201><s%> no longer <S%H5750><s%> hide <S%H6845><s%> him, <S%H3947><s%> she took a papyrus <S%H1573><s%> basket <S%H8392><s%> for him, <S%H2560><s%> and coated it with tar <S%H2564><s%> and with pitch. <S%H2203><s%> She put <S%H7760><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> in it, <S%H7760><s%> and laid it in the reeds <S%H5488><s%> by the river <S%H2975><s%>'s bank. <S%H8193><s%>
His sister <S%H269><s%> stood <S%H3320><s%> far off, <S%H7350><s%> to see <S%H3045><s%> what would be done to him. <S%H6213><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> to bathe <S%H7364><s%> at the river. <S%H2975><s%> Her maidens <S%H5291><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> along by the <S%H2975><s%> riverside. <S%H3027><s%> She saw <S%H7200><s%> the basket <S%H8392><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the reeds, <S%H5488><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> her handmaid <S%H519><s%> to get it. <S%H3947><s%>

She opened <S%H6605><s%> it, <S%H7200><s%> and saw the child, <S%H3206><s%> and behold, <S%H5288><s%> the baby cried. <S%H1058><s%> She had compassion <S%H2550><s%> on him, <S%H559><s%> and said, "This is one of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%>' children. <S%H3206><s%>"

Then his sister <S%H269><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s daughter, <S%H1323><s%> "Should I go <S%H3212><s%> and call <S%H7121><s%> a nurse <S%H3243><s%> for you from the Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> women, <S%H802><s%> that she may nurse <S%H3243><s%> the child for you? <S%H3206><s%>"

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H3212><s%> "Go." The maiden <S%H5959><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%>'s mother. <S%H517><s%>

Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H3212><s%> "Take this child <S%H3206><s%> away, <S%H3212><s%> and nurse <S%H3243><s%> him for me, <S%H5414><s%> and I will give you your wages. <S%H7939><s%>" The woman <S%H802><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the child, <S%H3206><s%> and nursed it. <S%H5134><s%>

The child <S%H3206><s%> grew, <S%H1431><s%> and she brought <S%H935><s%> him to Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>'s daughter, <S%H1323><s%> and he became her son. <S%H1121><s%> She named <S%H8034><s%> him <S%H7121><s%> Moses, <S%H4872><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Because I drew <S%H4871><s%> him out of the water. <S%H4325><s%>"

It happened in those days, <S%H3117><s%> when Moses <S%H4872><s%> had grown <S%H1431><s%> up, <S%H3318><s%> that he went out to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and looked <S%H7200><s%> at their burdens. <S%H5450><s%> He saw <S%H7200><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> striking <S%H5221><s%> a Hebrew, <S%H5680><s%> one of his brothers. <S%H251><s%>

He looked <S%H6437><s%> this way <S%H3541><s%> and that way, <S%H3541><s%> and when he saw <S%H7200><s%> that there was no one, <S%H376><s%> he killed <S%H5221><s%> the Egyptian, <S%H4713><s%> and hid <S%H2934><s%> him in the sand. <S%H2344><s%>

He went out <S%H3318><s%> the second <S%H8145><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> and behold, <S%H8147><s%> two men <S%H582><s%> of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%> were fighting <S%H5327><s%> with each other. <S%H559><s%> He said to him who did the wrong, <S%H7563><s%> "Why do you strike <S%H5221><s%> your fellow? <S%H7453><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Who made <S%H7760><s%> you <S%H376><s%> a prince <S%H8269><s%> and a judge <S%H8199><s%> over us? <S%H559><s%> Do you plan to kill <S%H2026><s%> me, <S%H2026><s%> as you killed the Egyptian? <S%H4713><s%>" Moses <S%H4872><s%> was afraid, <S%H3372><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Surely <S%H403><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%> is known. <S%H3045><s%>"

Now when Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> this thing, <S%H1697><s%> he sought <S%H1245><s%> to kill <S%H2026><s%> Moses. <S%H4872><s%> But Moses <S%H4872><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> from the face <S%H6440><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian, <S%H4080><s%> and he sat down <S%H3427><s%> by a well. <S%H875><s%>

Now the priest <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> had seven <S%H7651><s%> daughters. <S%H1323><s%> They came <S%H935><s%> and drew <S%H1802><s%> water, <S%H4390><s%> and filled the troughs <S%H7298><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> their father <S%H1><s%>'s flock. <S%H6629><s%>

The shepherds <S%H7462><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and drove them away; <S%H1644><s%> but Moses <S%H4872><s%> stood up <S%H6965><s%> and helped <S%H3467><s%> them, <S%H8248><s%> and watered their flock. <S%H6629><s%>

When they came <S%H935><s%> to Reuel, <S%H7467><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> "How <S%H4069><s%> is it that you have returned <S%H935><s%> so early <S%H4116><s%> today? <S%H3117><s%>"

They said, <S%H559><s%> "An Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the shepherds, <S%H7462><s%> and moreover he drew <S%H1802><s%> water <S%H1802><s%> for us, <S%H8248><s%> and watered the flock. <S%H6629><s%>"

He said <S%H559><s%> to his daughters, <S%H1323><s%> "Where is he? <S%H5800><s%> Why is it that you have left the man? <S%H376><s%> Call <S%H7121><s%> him, <S%H398><s%> that he may eat bread. <S%H3899><s%>"
Moses <S%H4872><s%> was content <S%H2974><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> with the man. <S%H376><s%> He gave <S%H5414><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> Zipporah, <S%H6855><s%> his daughter. <S%H1323><s%>

She bore <S%H3205><s%> a son, <S%H1121><s%> and he named <S%H8034><s%> him <S%H7121><s%> Gershom, <S%H1647><s%> for he said, <S%H559><s%> "I have lived as a foreigner <S%H1616><s%> in a foreign <S%H5237><s%> land. <S%H776><s%>"

It happened in the course <S%H1992><s%> of those many days, <S%H3117><s%> that the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> died, <S%H4191><s%> and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> sighed <S%H584><s%> because of <S%H4480><s%> the bondage, <S%H5656><s%> and they cried, <S%H2199><s%> and their cry <S%H7775><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> to God <S%H430><s%> because of the bondage. <S%H5656><s%>

God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> their groaning, <S%H5009><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> his covenant <S%H1285><s%> with Abraham, <S%H85><s%> with Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> and with Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
God <S%H430><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> was concerned about them. <S%H3045><s%>
